text: They automatically take effect right away
Hi <@U7SL518D6> so if I add a section to a template for lets say the home page of my site, it doesn't push to the home page unless I create a new Home Page using that template.
Incorrect. If you edit a template that is currently in use all pages with that template get updated
Thats why its a best practice when making major changes to clone the template stage the page and swap the staged page to use the cloned template and make your changes on the clone
Publish from staging when ready to go live

Maybe I'm not explaining myself well - this is what I am referring to:  <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/i-updated-a-module-content-on-my-template-why-are-the-changes-not-displaying-on-my-content>
That article needs some clarification thats fairly misleading

What i said above is still accurate.

If you have modules in a flex column and you add or move modules in that flex column at the template level it only affects new pages. Modules which are locked and modules which have the default content but are unlocked WILL be updated on existing pages if you update them
Modules that are unlocked and have been edited at the page level will not be updated
